instructions.notes:
Cut lemongrass to leave you with just the bottom 8 cm. Peel off the reedy outer layers, then trim the tough base off, leaving you with a pale green/white stem. This part will be used for the paste. The trimmings are used in the beef braising broth.
This curry is not supposed to be spicy, just a warm hum. This recipe is made with the generic Asian dried chillies purchased from Asian grocery stores which are usually not that spicy.
Massaman is supposed to be made with large pieces of meat, rather than small bite size pieces, so the meat needs to be slow cooked to become tender and absorbs the flavour of the braising liquid. Can be substituted with brisket but make sure you trim off the thick layer of fat, otherwise the sauce ends up too greasy. Gravy beef is also suitable, as long as you can find large pieces.

steps.action: Remove reedy outer layers and trim
steps.postAction: Reserve all the trimmings (for beef). Finely chop the white part (for paste).
Liquid should almost cover beef but not completely.

steps.action: Add lemongrass trimmings. Bring to boil over high heat, then reduce heat and simmer gently for 1.5 – 2 hours until beef is fork tender.
steps.postAction: Remove beef. If there’s much more than 1.5 cups liquid, simmer to reduce. Set liquid aside.

steps.postAction: Toast for 30 seconds or until they start to smell fragrant – do not let them burn. Immediately transfer into bowl.

steps.action: Blend chillies in food processor until finely chopped. Add galangal/ginger, garlic, finely chopped lemongrass, eschalots, the toasted spices and 5 tbsp water and blend to a paste.
Place oil in a pot or large skillet over medium high heat. Add curry paste and cook for 3 minutes until the liquid has cooked out and it’s thick and fragrant.

steps.postAction: Also add reserved beef braising liquid. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 3 minutes.

steps.action: Divide the batter between two 20cm baking trays and place in the oven preheated to 170°C for 20-25 minutes.

steps.postAction: Beat until pale and fluffy.

steps.action: In a pan over medium heat add
steps.postAction: Bring to a simmer.

steps.action: Pour hot cream into the egg yolk mixture while whisking.
steps.postAction: Transfer back to the pan and cook until it thickens.
Transfer mixture to a bowl, cover and place in the fridge for an hour.
Beat until fluffy.

steps.action: Gradually add chilled cream and whisk until combined.
Place one sponge on top of the other with a layer of cream in between. Spread the rest of the cream over the cake.
steps.postAction: Decorate with almond slices and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.

instructions.notes: Preheat oven to 170°C. Line a 20cm baking tray with baking paper.

steps.postAction: Beat until pale and fluffy.
Fold until incorporated.
Beat until foamy.
Beat to stiff peaks.

steps.action: Gradually fold the egg whites into the egg yolks mixture, 1-2 tablespoons at a time.
steps.postAction: Fold until combined.

steps.action: Pour the batter into the baking tray and sprinkle sliced pistachios on top.
steps.postAction: Bake for 30 minutes until golden brown on top.

instructions.notes: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a 20cm baking tray with baking paper.

steps.postAction: Place the bowl over a pot with simmering water and melt the chocolate and butter.
Beat until pale and fluffy.

steps.action: Pour the chocolate mixture into the egg yolk mixture and combine.

steps.postAction: Beat until foamy.
Whisk to stiff peaks.

steps.action: Gradually fold egg whites into the chocolate almond mixture.
steps.postAction: Pour the batter into the baking tray and place it in the oven for about 30 minutes.

steps.action: Decorate with icing sugar and serve with whipped cream, (vanilla) ice cream or fruits.

instructions.notes: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a 23cm baking tray with baking paper.

steps.postAction: Beat until creamy.
Add eggs one at a time.

steps.action: Place a colander over the bowl and add
steps.postAction: Shake the ingredients into the bowl and mix just until combined.

steps.action: Pour the batter into the baking tray, place raspberries on top and transfer to the oven for 1 hour.

instructions.notes: Grate carrot. Preheat oven to 170°C. Line a 20cm baking tray with baking paper.

steps.postAction: Add eggs one at a time.

steps.action: Gradually fold dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.
Divide the batter in 2 parts and bake for 35-45 minutes.

steps.postAction: Beat until fluffy.
Beat until desired consistency is reached.

steps.action: Place one of the sponges on top of the other with a layer of frosting in between. Decorate the cake with the rest of the frosting and pecan nuts.

instructions.notes: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a 23cm baking tray with baking paper. Blend oats to flour, peel and grate apples.

steps.postAction: Create a layer with the grated butter.

steps.action: Spread one third tablespoons of the oat mixture over the butter then spread one third of the grated apples over the oat mix.
steps.postAction: Repeat spreading oat mixture and grated apples until finished.

steps.action: On top of the baking tray grate
steps.postAction: Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of sugar on top.

steps.action: Bake for 35-45 minutes until golden on top.
steps.postAction: Cool completely before serving.

instructions.notes: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a 25cm baking tray with baking paper.

steps.action: Place a colander over the bowl and add
steps.postAction: Shake the flour mix into the bowl and whisk until incorporated..

steps.action: Place the pan over medium heat and stir to a pudding like consistency.
steps.postAction: Transfer to a bowl and let it cool a bit.

steps.action: Place the batter in the tray and spread pudding on top.
steps.postAction: Bake for 30-35 minutes.

instructions.notes: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a 20x23cm baking tray with parchment paper.

steps.postAction: Melt chocolate and butter then set aside to cool.
Beat until light and fluffy.
Use a spatula to mix.

steps.action: Pour the batter into the prepared baking tray and bake for 30 minutes.
steps.postAction: Let it cool in the pan for 30 minutes before slicing.

instructions.notes: Preheat oven to 175°C. Line a 23x13cm baking tray with baking paper.

steps.action: Fold the flour mix into the greek yogurt mix.
steps.postAction: Pour the batter into the pan and bake for 50 minutes.

instructions.notes: Preheat oven to 175°C. Line a 23cm baking tray with baking paper.

steps.postAction: Beat until light and creamy.
Add the eggs one at a time.
Mix until fully combined.

steps.action: Gradually fold the dry ingredients into the ricotta mixture.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
steps.postAction: Bake for 50 to 55 minutes.

instructions.notes: Preheat oven to 215°C. Butter a 23cm baking dish. Strain the ricotta cheese and discard the liquid.

steps.postAction: Mix, starting on low and increasing to medium-low until light and fluffy.

steps.action: Pour the batter into the baking tray and bake for 30 minutes; then reduce the heat to 190°C and bake for another 40 to 45 minutes or until the batter has mostly firmed up and the top of the cake has gained a nice golden brown colour.
steps.postAction: Let the cake cool completely and then refrigerate for at least 6 hours.
